billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS

title: Authorizes payment of war bonus provided in chapter 547 of the laws of 1947 to members of the merchant marines
summary: Extends the authorization for payment of the war bonus provided for in chapter 547 of the laws of 1947 to members of the merchant marines who served at sea during World War II, or their next of kin.
currentCommittee: VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Veterans, Homeland Securi-
         ty and Military Affairs

       AN ACT to amend chapter 547 of the laws of 1947, relating  to  providing
         for  the  payment  of  bonuses  to  members of the armed forces of the
         United States from this state, in relation to payment of such  bonuses
         to members of the merchant marines who served in World War II or their
         next of kin

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 1 of chapter 547 of the laws of 1947,  relating  to
    2  providing  for  the payment of bonuses to members of the armed forces of
    3  the United States from this state, is amended by adding a  new  subdivi-
    4  sion (g) to read as follows:
    5    (G)  NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISIONS OF THIS CHAPTER, THIS SUBDI-
    6  VISION SHALL BE EFFECTIVE UNTIL MARCH 31,  2012  AND  NO  BONUS  PAYMENT
    7  SHALL  BE  MADE  ON  APPLICATIONS  FILED  SUBSEQUENT TO SUCH DATE BY ANY
    8  PERSON QUALIFIED UNDER THIS SUBDIVISION, UNLESS SUCH  PERSON  CAN  PROVE
    9  THAT  EITHER HE OR SHE WAS INCAPABLE OF MAKING SUCH APPLICATION PRIOR TO
   10  SUCH DATE BECAUSE OF PHYSICAL OR MENTAL INCAPACITY. ANY  MEMBER  OF  THE
   11  MERCHANT  MARINES  WHO  SERVED AT SEA AT ANY TIME DURING THE PERIOD FROM
   12  DECEMBER 7, 1941 TO SEPTEMBER 2, 1945, BOTH INCLUSIVE, WHO WAS  A  RESI-
   13  DENT  OF  THIS STATE FOR AT LEAST SIX MONTHS PRIOR TO SUCH SERVICE SHALL
   14  BE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE A WAR BONUS IN THE AMOUNT OF  TWO  HUNDRED  FIFTY
   15  DOLLARS. IN THE EVENT SUCH MEMBER IS DECEASED, SUCH BONUS SHALL BE PAYA-
   16  BLE TO THE NEXT OF KIN OF SUCH MEMBER. THE DIVISION OF VETERANS' AFFAIRS
   17  IS  AUTHORIZED TO MAKE BONUS PAYMENTS UNDER THIS SUBDIVISION AFTER MARCH
   18  31, 2010 ON APPLICATIONS RECEIVED OR PENDING ON OR BEFORE SUCH DATE. ANY
   19  INCONSISTENT PROVISION OF THIS CHAPTER OR OTHER GENERAL OR  SPECIAL  LAW
   20  NOTWITHSTANDING, PAYMENTS OF WAR BONUS CLAIMS AFTER MARCH 31, 2012 SHALL
   21  BE MADE FROM FUNDS APPROPRIATED TO THE DIVISION OF VETERANS' AFFAIRS FOR
   22  THIS PURPOSE FROM THE STATE PURPOSES FUND PORTION OF THE GENERAL FUND OF
   23  THE STATE.
   24    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2070

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend chapter 547 of the laws of 1947, relating to providing for
the
payment of bonuses to members of the armed forces of the United States
from this state, in relation to payment of such bonuses to members of
the merchant marines who served in World War II or their next of kin

PURPOSE/SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
To provide war
bonuses to members of
the merchant marine who served at sea during World War II, or their
next of kin. Adds subdivision (e) to Section 9701 of the
Unconsolidated Laws to provide a $250 bonus to members of the
merchant marine who served at sea during World War II.

JUSTIFICATION:
In 1947, the Legislature enacted
Section 9701 of the
Unconsolidated Laws providing war bonuses to members of the armed
forces who served during world War II, or their next of kin. Members
of the armed forces included the Army, Navy, Army Air Corps,
Marines, Coast guard, Women's Army Auxiliary Corps, Women's Air
Corps, Waves, Spars, Women Marines, Public Health Service and Coast
and Geodetic Survey. Four hundred million in bonds were floated to
fund the payment of the war bonuses. In 1988, the Federal Government
conferred veteran status upon Merchant Marines. Thereafter, the State
Legislature enacted legislation which conferred veteran status upon
Merchant Marines. Unfortunately, however,the time in which to apply
for war bonuses expired on March 31, 1965. As a result of which,
members of the merchant marine who served during the war were unable
to claim their bonuses. The Merchant Marines were an integral and
critical component of the war effort, transporting troops, artillery
and supplies to combat theaters. Although they were not considered
military personnel, more than 5,000 Merchant Marines lost their lives
during the war, incurring a casualty rate second only to the Marines.
While a $250 bonus is not a lot of
money in today's economy, it represents payment of debt of gratitude
which is long overdue.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
It is estimated that 5,000 merchant marines and
340 next of kin would be eligible for the bonus. If all applied, the
total cost would be $1,335,000.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
